title: Comcast Enters Smart-TV Market With Launch of Sky Glass in Europe
sub_head: Broadband-powered TV, which runs Comcast’s operating system, will let U.K. users access TV without a satellite dish
body:
Comcast Corp. on Thursday said it has built a smart TV that will run on its own operating system, the company’s latest answer to the streaming wars.
The broadband-powered smart TV, called Sky Glass, will be available to U.K. customers of Sky, Comcast’s European pay-TV unit, later this month and in other European markets next year. The company wouldn’t say whether a Comcast-powered smart TV would be launched in the U.S. soon.
